uh the exact coordinates of matches in API traffic and the exact location of
five other apps could be exfiltrated using different types of trilateration
attacks so a first type of trilateration is exact distance
trilateration so in this scenario the app exposes the exact distance to a
victim so this means that an attacker can spoof its location obtain uh the exact distance to
a victim and with this victim the attacker is able to construct a
circle now if the attacker uh SPO two other random locations and repeats this
exact procedure the intersection point of the three circles will reveal the uh
the precise location of our victim now we should note here uh that
uh so we found that grinder is vulnerable to this form of trilateration uh but we should note here
that grinder rounds the coordinates of a user up to three decimal places before
sending it to uh to to their servers which limits the location accuracy to
approximately 100 m uh however we believe that an uncertainty of 100 m is
still insufficient to uh to guarantee users privacy especially in sportly
populated areas now in response to exact
trations ex exact tration Services generalized uh distances so rounded the
distances um to an integer value and this however this is not a solution as I
will demonstrate so an adversary can still spoof its location and obtain around the distance and by gradually
shifting until this rounded distance flips the attacker uh will will be able
to obtain the rounding point and with this rounding Point uh the attacker will be able to construct a
circle Again by repeating this procedure two times more uh the attacker will be
able to um to to to reveal the victim's location now we found in our study that
happen is vulnerable to this form of trilateration now a last form of um
trilateration is uh trilateration using a proximity Oracle so adversaries can
leverage leverage this proximity Oracle that indicates through a binary signal
whether a victim is located within a proximity distance uh from the attacker to
trate now this distance can either be a fixed distance set by the service or a
distance that the attacker can control uh using a filter as is demonstrated on uh the the right top of the

proximity of the victim and next the adversary will gradually shift uh its

knows um that uh the victim is located at exactly this proximity
distance again um repeating this procedure two times more uh will yield
uh the the location of our victim so uh we uh found that Badu uh
Bumble hinch and hilly were vulnerable uh to this form of trilateration uh but
